alert.note: Alert for Pike; Scioto (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 27 at 9:31PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF SOUTHEASTERN PIKE AND SCIOTO COUNTIES THROUGH 1000 PM EDT... At 930 PM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was located near Sciotodale, moving southeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph, pea size hail, and very heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Hail may cause minor damage to outdoor objects. Visibility will be poor and hydroplaning is possible. Locations impacted include... Portsmouth, Wheelersburg, New Boston, South Webster, Rosemount, Clarktown, Lucasville, Sciotodale, Otway, Wakefield, Lombardsville, Stockdale, Minford, West Portsmouth, State Route 335 at State Route 776, Mcdermott, Powellsville, Portsmouth Regional Airport, Bear Creek and Lyra. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a sturdy building. Motorists should slow down and use extra caution. To report hazardous weather conditions, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
